content.webTitle: Classical CD of the week: Bruckner, Symphony No 3

fields.headline: Bruckner, Symphony No 3
fields.bodyText: Bruckner Symphony No 3 Deutsches Symphonie-Orchester Berlin/ Nagano (Harmonia Mundi HMC 901817) With at least three versions of Bruckner's third symphony to choose from, Kent Nagano opts for the original 1873 score, neither published nor performed during Bruckner's lifetime. Replete with quotations from Wagner which he subsequently deleted, it was aired by Nagano in a 2002 Barbican concert which impressed with its majestic sweep. Nothing less than 'the juxtaposition of the joys and sorrows of life' is Bruckner's bold aspiration for the last movement, climaxing a titanic second half which grows organically from a more tentative opening. In what will surely prove a landmark performance, Nagano wrings every last nuance from fine German players.
